column4: H, disconnected so I'll ask again: I had Ubuntu on one partition and installed Vista on another partition. Vista took over the boot and doesn't recognize Ubuntu. How can I configure a boot menu that features both OS's ?
boot into ubuntu using the cd and install grub
shirtless - Should the live CD allow me to boot into ubuntu ? Thought it only allows installing the OS.
it will allow you to boot into ubuntu, yes. that's why it's 'live'
grub install info is on the ubuntu website
shirtless - oh, you mean it will not load the already installed Ubuntu but boot from CD. How do I install grub then ?
you don't need to be booted into your ubuntu install to install grub. just boot from cd and google for ubuntu grub install. it's like 3 easy steps
you might want to search grub2 instead
it will probably detect windows for you.
shirtless - thanks ! And are you actually shirtless ? Are you Australian ?
i am from the US, but I am not wearing a shirt. Can you clue me in on the australian part?
shirtless - I'm too lazy to go over search results in ubuntu.com. Can you give me a link to the grub install info page ?
i am going to pm you the link
